metadata.title: MCP Rust
metadata.description: Rust implementation of Model Context Protocol

footer.brandDescription: Rust implementation of the Model Context Protocol
footer.copyright: MCP Rust - Model Context Protocol Implementation

home.title: MCP Rust
home.subtitle: High-performance Rust implementation of the Model Context Protocol. Full-featured SDK with multiple transport layers.

multipleTransports.title: Multiple Transports
multipleTransports.description: Support for Stdio, HTTP/SSE (Streamable HTTP), WebSocket, and legacy SSE transports. Choose the right transport for your use case.

completeMcpSupport.title: Complete MCP Support
completeMcpSupport.description: Full implementation of Tools, Resources, and Prompts. Register handlers and let the SDK handle the protocol.

securityBuiltIn.title: Security Built-in
securityBuiltIn.description: OAuth 2.1 authentication with PKCE support and DNS rebinding protection. Secure by default.

realTimeStreaming.title: Real-time Streaming
realTimeStreaming.description: True SSE streaming with bidirectional message push, Last-Event-ID reconnection replay, and CORS support.

asyncAwaitNative.title: Async/Await Native
asyncAwaitNative.description: Built on Tokio for high-performance async operations. Non-blocking I/O throughout.

modularDesign.title: Modular Design
modularDesign.description: Separate core, client, and server crates. Use only what you need with feature flags.

home.trackingParity: Tracking feature parity with the TypeScript SDK

docs.subtitle: Learn how to use MCP Rust to build Model Context Protocol applications.

architecture.title: Architecture
architecture.subtitle: Understand the module structure and code organization of MCP Rust.
architecture.coreLibraryDesc: Shared type definitions, protocol, and utilities.
architecture.serverLibraryDesc: MCP server implementation with HTTP, WebSocket, and legacy SSE transports.
architecture.clientLibraryDesc: MCP client implementation with multiple transport options.

httpSse.title: HTTP/SSE Transport
httpSse.subtitle: Real-time streaming with Server-Sent Events (SSE) over HTTP.
httpSse.reconnectionDesc: The client supports automatic reconnection with configurable backoff:

websocket.title: WebSocket Transport
websocket.subtitle: Full-duplex bidirectional communication over WebSocket.
websocket.subprotocolDesc: WebSocket connections use the MCP subprotocol:
websocket.messageFormatDesc: All messages are JSON-RPC 2.0 formatted text messages.

legacySse.title: Legacy HTTP+SSE Transport
legacySse.subtitle: Backward-compatible transport for protocol version 2024-11-05.
legacySse.deprecationNotice: This transport is deprecated and only intended for backward compatibility with older MCP clients. New implementations should use Streamable HTTP.
legacySse.supportBothProtocolsDesc: Run both Streamable HTTP and legacy SSE on the same server:
legacySse.compatServerDesc: Run the included compat server that supports both protocols:

auth.title: OAuth Authentication
auth.subtitle: Secure your MCP server with OAuth 2.1 and DNS rebinding protection.
auth.dnsRebindingDesc: DNS rebinding protection prevents malicious websites from accessing local servers by validating the Host header.
auth.oauth21Desc: Complete OAuth 2.1 authorization flow implementation with support for:
auth.bearerAuthDesc: Protect your MCP endpoints with Bearer token authentication:
auth.clientOAuthDesc: Authenticate your MCP client with OAuth:

examples.title: Examples
examples.subtitle: Complete working examples demonstrating MCP Rust capabilities. Each example includes full source code, build instructions, and test commands.
examples.serverExamplesDesc: MCP servers expose tools, resources, and prompts to AI assistants. These examples demonstrate different transport layers and server capabilities.
examples.clientExamplesDesc: MCP clients connect to servers and invoke tools, read resources, and use prompts. These examples show how to establish connections using different transports.
examples.runningExamplesDesc: All examples can be run from the repository root:

httpServer.title: HTTP Server
httpServer.description: MCP server with HTTP/SSE transport, featuring true SSE streaming and Last-Event-ID replay

websocketServer.title: WebSocket Server
websocketServer.description: MCP server with full-duplex WebSocket communication and MCP subprotocol negotiation

filesystemServer.title: Filesystem Server
filesystemServer.description: MCP server providing file operations via stdio transport with roots support

promptsServer.title: Prompts Server
promptsServer.description: MCP server demonstrating prompts registration and dynamic message generation

tasksServer.title: Tasks Server
tasksServer.description: MCP server showcasing async task execution with polling and cancellation

loggingServer.title: Logging Server
loggingServer.description: MCP server with logging notifications and structured log levels

sseCompatServer.title: SSE Compat Server
sseCompatServer.description: Legacy SSE transport compatibility layer for older MCP clients

httpClient.description: MCP client connecting via HTTP with auto-reconnection and SSE streaming

websocketClient.description: MCP client with WebSocket transport for full-duplex communication

filesystemClient.title: Filesystem Client
filesystemClient.description: MCP client connecting to filesystem server via stdio

httpServer.subtitle: A complete MCP server using HTTP/SSE transport with Axum. This example demonstrates true SSE streaming with bidirectional communication.
